metadata.title: USN-5634-1 -- Linux kernel (OEM) vulnerability
metadata.description: Domingo Dirutigliano and Nicola Guerrera discovered that the netfilter subsystem in the Linux kernel did not properly handle rules that truncated packets below the packet header size. When such rules are in place, a remote attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-5634-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  linux-image-unsigned-5.17.0-1017-oem - 5.17.0-1017.18 linux-image-5.17.0-1017-oem - 5.17.0-1017.18 linux-modules-iwlwifi-5.17.0-1017-oem - 5.17.0-1017.18 linux-oem-5.17-tools-5.17.0-1017 - 5.17.0-1017.18 linux-modules-5.17.0-1017-oem - 5.17.0-1017.18 linux-oem-5.17-headers-5.17.0-1017 - 5.17.0-1017.18 linux-oem-5.17-tools-host - 5.17.0-1017.18 linux-headers-5.17.0-1017-oem - 5.17.0-1017.18 linux-tools-5.17.0-1017-oem - 5.17.0-1017.18 linux-buildinfo-5.17.0-1017-oem - 5.17.0-1017.18 No subscription required  linux-image-oem-22.04 - 5.17.0.1017.16 linux-modules-iwlwifi-oem-22.04 - 5.17.0.1017.16 linux-headers-oem-22.04a - 5.17.0.1017.16 linux-image-oem-22.04a - 5.17.0.1017.16 linux-oem-22.04 - 5.17.0.1017.16 linux-modules-iwlwifi-oem-22.04a - 5.17.0.1017.16 linux-oem-22.04a - 5.17.0.1017.16 linux-tools-oem-22.04a - 5.17.0.1017.16 linux-tools-oem-22.04 - 5.17.0.1017.16 linux-headers-oem-22.04 - 5.17.0.1017.16 No subscription required
